poem:
**The Peculiar Mix**

In Istanbul, they gather  
like mismatched pieces of a forgotten chess set,  
absent the kings and bishops,  
just pawns and curious knights  
clinking cups of tea,  
filling rooms with the murmurs of maps  
and the nervous rustling of history,  
seeking a harmony  
amidst the dissonance of the morning.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Who are the diplomats Russia and Ukraine are sending to peace talks in Istanbul? Ukraine and Russia are due to hold their first direct peace talks in more than three years in Istanbul on Thursday and Friday, though the exact timing and format remain unclear. Moscow has notably withheld its top diplomatic heavyweights – including Vladimir Putin’s chief foreign policy aide, Yuri Ushakov, and his foreign minister, Sergei Lavrov – instead dispatching a peculiar mix". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
